results.title: Pleasantville
results.brief_description: Geeky David and his popular twin Jennifer get sucked into a black-and-white 1950s TV sitcom world and find it anything but peachy keen. When Jennifer’s modern attitude disrupts Pleasantville’s peaceful but boring routine, she literally brings color into its life.

constellations_other.name: 1950s television
constellations_other.description: "Good evening ... and welcome to television." Bruce Gyngell’s famous words launched television in Australia in 1956 on Sydney’s TCN9, with the medium finally arriving in the country towards the later end of the decade.

results.description: Geeky teenager David and his popular twin sister, Jennifer, get sucked into the black-and-white world of a 1950s TV sitcom called “Pleasantville,” and find a world where everything is peachy keen all the time. But when Jennifer’s modern attitude disrupts Pleasantville’s peaceful but boring routine, she literally brings color into its life.
description_for_label: Geeky teenager David and his popular twin sister, Jennifer, get sucked into the black-and-white world of a 1950s TV sitcom called “Pleasantville,” and find a world where everything is peachy keen all the time. But when Jennifer’s modern attitude disrupts Pleasantville’s peaceful but boring routine, she literally brings color into its life.

results.title: Pleasantville
results.creator_credit: Gary Ross, Steven Soderbergh, Robert J. Degus, Jon Kilik and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dejected teenager David (Tobey Maguire) suffers all the complexities of 90s adolescence. Confronted by doomsaying school teachers and dwindling job prospects, David seeks refuge in his favourite TV show - an old-fashioned, black and white sitcom called Pleasantville. One fateful night a mysterious TV repairman transports David and his precocious sister Jennifer (Reese Witherspoon) inside the fantastic world of Pleasantville, where life is a curious routine of niceties and home-spun values. But the pair’s arrival turns everyday life on its head for the small town, until now untouched by concepts of sex, rebellion, and most notably, colour. An insightful satire of the American Dream, Pleasantville combines pioneering photographic techniques with a stellar cast including Joan Allen, J.T. Walsh, William H. Macy, Jeff Daniels and comic legend Don Knotts as the elusive TV repairman.

results.title: Plaza = The Beach
results.creator_credit: Edward Sturlis, Andrzej Jozwikiewicz and Studio Malych Form Filmowych Se-Ma-For
results.brief_description: Two cheeky tattoos escape from the chests of two sailors to wreak havoc on unsuspecting sunbathers, returning when the pace of their pranks gets out of hand. A comic short film, effectively combining real life with animation.

results.title: Playtime [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jacques Tati, Rene Silvera and Specta Films
results.brief_description: The third of Tati’s films to feature the gangling form of Monsieur Hulot, “Playtime” is a surreal, comic vision of mankind’s battle against the overwhelming depersonalisation of modern city life. Filmed upon one of the most ambitious and imaginative sets ever to grace the screen, Tati’s cinematic magnum opus took three years and a reported one million pounds to shoot. The result is a startling triumph acclaimed by the international media as Tati’s finest work. Also available on VHS [302002].

results.title: PlayTime
results.brief_description: He attempts to meet with a business contact but soon becomes lost.

constellations_other.name: Sounds unreal
constellations_other.description: A history of syncing sound effects, a craft known as Foley in the USA and bootstepping in the UK.

results.description: Clumsy Monsieur Hulot finds himself perplexed by the intimidating complexity of a gadget-filled Paris. He attempts to meet with a business contact but soon becomes lost. His roundabout journey parallels that of an American tourist, and as they weave through the inventive urban environment, they intermittently meet, developing an interest in one another. They eventually get together at a chaotic restaurant, along with several other quirky characters.
description_for_label: Clumsy Monsieur Hulot finds himself perplexed by the intimidating complexity of a gadget-filled Paris. He attempts to meet with a business contact but soon becomes lost. results.title: Playing with numbers (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The main part of this program concerns an examination of the types of numbers that arise. Rational numbers, algebraic numbers and irrational numbers are illustrated and discussed.

results.title: Playing with fire
results.creator_credit: Michael Law and Central Office of Information Film For The Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: Various situations where accidents occur when children are left unsupervised such as pulling a pot of boiling liquid from a stove, reaching to close to a fire without a guard.
